clinical_study.brief_title: The Study of Using Esophageal Pressure to Guide the PEEP Setting in Abdominal Hypertension Patients Who Undergoing Mechanical Ventilation
clinical_study.official_title: the Study of Using Esophageal Pressure to Guide the PEEP Setting in Abdominal Hypertension Patients Who Undergoing Mechanical Ventilation

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

brief_summary.textblock: Intra-abdominal hypertension can increase the pleural pressure, and then end-expiratory transpulmonary pressures will be turn to negative, Pulmonary atelectasis/acute lung injury/acute respiratory distress syndrome will appear. In the group of people who suffering intra-abdominal hypertension, the investigators use the pressure of esophagus to speculate the Intrathoracic pressure, and to setting PEEP in order to decrease the happening of ALI/ARDS, which may decrease morbidity in this population.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.description: Comparison of two groups the duration of ventilation-free in 28d,ventilator-free day include weaning from mechanical ventilation more than 24h.

secondary_outcome.description: 28-Day mortality include patients who giving up treatment due to critical condition

intervention.description: titrated setting peep according to esophageal pressure in experimental group; setting peep on the patient's PaO2 and FiO2 in control group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- intra-abdominal hypertension
- mechanical ventilation
- sedation
Exclusion Criteria:
- underlying pulmonary disease
- age older than 60 years and younger than 18 years
- vital signs were not stable
- non voluntary

responsible_party.investigator_title: PLA Research Institute of general surgery
